title: Team Member Feels Unappreciated
summary: A hygienist says they feel invisible in the office. Validate their experience and ask for specific examples; build recognition into the culture.

scene.setting: A hygienist says they feel invisible in the office. You may feel dismissive or defensive; the hidden risk is morale dropping if you dismiss the concern. The decision point is protect your perspective vs validate theirs.

beats.narration: They've shared that they feel unappreciated. The decision point is explain away or acknowledge and ask.

dialogue.speaker: lead
dialogue.line: I hear that you feel that way. Can you give me one or two specific examples so I can do something about it?

choices.label: Explain that everyone feels busy and it's not personal.

steps.step: Validate: 'I hear that you feel that way'; ask what would help; take it seriously.

leader_lines: I may have explained away. I hear you—what would help?
How do you validate without agreeing?
questions: What would make you feel seen?
What's one thing we could change?
scripts.closing_line: Validate; ask what would help; follow up with action.

choices.label: Acknowledge their feelings and ask for specific examples.

steps.step: One concrete recognition action: shout-out, include in a decision, or visibility of contribution.

leader_lines: I hear you. What would help you feel more seen?
Give me one or two examples.
questions: How do we build recognition into the culture?
Regular thanks or inclusion in decisions?
scripts.closing_line: Regular shout-outs or thanks; include in decisions; visibility of contribution.

choices.label: Change the subject and move on.

steps.step: Address as soon as they bring it up: curiosity not defensiveness; follow up with one action.

leader_lines: I don't want to move on—I want to hear you. When must we address this?
questions: What would make you feel appreciated?
What's one thing I can do this week?
scripts.closing_line: Address now; curiosity; one follow-up action.

choices.label: Promise to do better and give a generic thank-you.

steps.step: Ask them directly what specific recognition would help; commit to one action.

leader_lines: Generic thanks isn't enough. What specific recognition would help?
What would you like—public acknowledgment, involvement in a decision?
questions: How do we make it visible?
scripts.closing_line: One specific action; follow up in writing.

system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you protect your perspective or validate theirs?

outcomes.message: They may feel dismissed. Morale and retention can suffer.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with acknowledge-and-ask?
When must you address feeling unappreciated?

outcomes.message: They felt heard. Concrete recognition improved trust and stability.
reflection_questions: How do you build recognition into the culture?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I validated and acted on feeling unappreciated. (1-5)
